result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole L. Montgomery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:16 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Nicole L. Montgomery in court by Zoom video means, in custody at Taycheedah, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Court inquires how the matter is proceeding today.  Atty. Gutierrez advises he has filed the plea questionnaire and is prepared to proceed with plea and sentencing.  Atty. Gordon recites the offer.  Atty. Gutierrez confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Court also orders 21CM1789 dismissed and read into this case.

Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Gordon.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Gutierrez.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

60 Days Jail (Concurrent to any other current sentence). Sentence commences immediately.

FINE or COSTS: Waived by the Court.
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be converted a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered; filed by Atty. Luis Daniel Gutierrez
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:41 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Nicole L. Montgomery in court by Zoom video means, in custody at Taycheedah, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Court inquires how the matter will be proceeding today.  Atty. Gutierrez notes he only represents the defendant on this matter and 21CM1789 and notes that resolving these cases is contingent upon how his client resolves her felony matter.  Based on that Atty. Gutierrez is not prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing today on his matters.  Court will adjourn for a new plea and sentencing date.  Defendant to appear by video from Taycheedah for the next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:31 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Nicole L. Montgomery in court by Zoom video means, in custody at Taycheedah, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicole L. Montgomery appeared by video means with Attorney.  Atty. Gutierrez advises he has discovery and an offer, noting his cases will not be part of a global offer with the defendant felony case.  Atty. Guttierez is asking this case be set for plea and sentencing together with the felony matter.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Defendant to appear by video from Taycheedah for the next court date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
